pkgmetadata.longdescription: Multi-Fidelity Computer Experiments Using the Tuo-Wu-Yu Model // This R function implements the nonstationary Kriging model proposed by Tuo, Wu and Yu (2014) DOI:10.1080/00401706.2013.842935 for analyzing multi-fidelity computer outputs. This function computes the maximum likelihood estimates for the model parameters as well as the predictive means and variances of the exact solution (i.e., the conceptually highest fidelity).
